thread.title: Trump wastes no time responding to appeals court loss: 'SEE YOU IN COURT'
thread.title_full: Trump wastes no time responding to appeals court loss: 'SEE YOU IN COURT'

title: Trump wastes no time responding to appeals court loss: 'SEE YOU IN COURT'
text:
Live updates: 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals rules against Trump and travel ban will not go into effect Feb. 9, 2017, 3:39 p.m. 
The U.S. 9th Circuit Court of Appeals has ruled to continue blocking enforcement of President Trump â€™s travel ban. The unanimous decision means that a stay preventing a ban on on immigration from seven predominantly Muslim countries remains in place, at least for now. The ruling came after the three-judge panel heard arguments this week from the Justice Department and Washington state. 9th Circuit Court upholds stay 
Earlier this week: President Trump's words on Muslims come back to bite him. Judges ask about limiting parts of the travel ban, rather than blocking it entirely. Meet the three judges deciding whether to reinstate Trump's travel ban. Read Trump's executive order and legal filings for and against the executive order. Ruling Feb. 9, 2017, 3:38 p.m. Trump wastes no time responding to appeals court loss: 'SEE YOU IN COURT' Latest updates
